meanings.definition: Come into the presence or company of someone by chance or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: I will meet my friend at the park later.
meanings.sent2: Let's meet at the library to study together.
meanings.sent3: It was a pleasant surprise to meet my old teacher at the store.
meanings.sent4: Their eyes met across the crowded room, and it felt like fate.
meanings.sent5: The sun and the moon meet in the sky every evening.

meanings.definition: Come together with someone by chance or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: We will meet at the cafe for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The two friends met at the bus stop on their way home.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog meet in the garden every morning for a play.
meanings.sent4: The river meets the ocean, creating a beautiful estuary.
meanings.sent5: The train tracks meet at the station, connecting different cities.

meanings.definition: Fulfill or satisfy a need, requirement, or condition.
meanings.sent1: I hope this meal will meet your expectations.
meanings.sent2: The company strives to meet the demands of its customers.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream always meets my cravings for something sweet.
meanings.sent4: Her smile met his need for reassurance.
meanings.sent5: The warm soup met her cold hands, bringing comfort.

meanings.sent1: I will meet many challenges on my journey.
meanings.sent2: She met with success after years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The cat met with a surprise when it saw the mouse.
meanings.sent4: His eyes met with tears as he watched the sad movie.
meanings.sent5: The mountain climbers will meet with extreme weather conditions.
